title: Garrard
content:
Typeface?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Garrard.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229224712/http:/typophile.com/files/Garrard.pdf) | 23.1 KB |

 [‹ (x) "m" on M&Ms - (similar to) Aachen {Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229224712/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15891 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Covergirl masthead and pixel font - custom (similar to Radiant), Bubbledot Fine {Grant} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229224712/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15493 "Go to next forum topic")
author: idatj

comments.content:
[Steelplate Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229224712/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/steelplate-gothic-rr/) and [Engravers’ Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229224712/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/engravers-gothic/) are starts, but they’re just close.

I have a feeling since it’s for a company, it’s a custom face that’s just really close to most Gothics — there’s just something about that G glyph that doesn’t seem like it fits.

Could this be ’Adobe Sans’ again.? :)

_Edit-A-Bit.: I am still not able to post any images, within replies.. Am I missing something.? Everone else seems to be able to do so.. Hmm.._

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229224712/http:/www.formlos.net/)

Dav, did you see the new “Insert image” text (very small) right underneath your reply box? I almost missed it — see if that works.

_edit: heck, why not clarify with an example..._

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229224712im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/clarity.PNG)

Well, there is no such ’Insert image’ text below my reply box.. Sadly enough.. Not even a very small one.. Nada.. _( Thanks for posting an example, but that doesnt seem to work in my current browser.. Lousy, temporary Winlose machine.. Firefox doesnt like that, it seems.. )_

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229224712/http:/www.formlos.net/)

Addendum.: Back on a Mac.. It doesnt work in Safari, as well..  
_( Now, thats what I call a bug.. :)_

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229224712/http:/www.formlos.net/)

Hmm.. I’m using Firefox, oddly enough, but I used a .png graphic.. here’s a lower-qual JPG that might work..

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229224712im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/clarity.JPG)

Sorry, Ryan.. Your image worked, of course, but the ’link’ _( ’Insert image’ )_ is still not visible.. In none of the mentioned browsers.. _( At least for me.. ) Sorry for getting even more Off Topic.._

_\* One more ’Edit-A-Bit’.: I just upgraded to Safari 1.3.1 ( v312.3 ) and it still doesnt work.. Its not my day, today.._

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229224712/http:/www.formlos.net/)
have you installed the latest version of the flash player?
Wow! I didn’t even realize that was Flash... why on earth is it in flash, btw?
\*winking\* because christian is a genius and we shouldn’t question his techniques. \*/winking\*

You should question my techniques every chance you can get.

It’s flash because flash 8 lets you have a progress bar, doesn’t require you to pop up another browser window, provides more consistent client-side file-type and upload size feedback (so you don’t have to upload the entire file to the server to find out that it’s too big), and besides, I wanted to try out some new flash 8 stuff. \*wink\* There’s more on the way. Think sweet TypeID board \*/wink\*

Insert image is in place in Safari on Mac Os Tiger with Flash 8 installed - works fine

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229224712im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/bojevscreenshot.jpg)
Flash IS a wonderful tool, I use it all the time — just wondered what it was doing in a seemingly HTML-based forum. :)
Things are not always what they seem... :^P
